signature.embedding_text: If price of an item increases by X percent, by what percentage should consumption be decreased to keep the expenditure same

trick.name: Sign Flip Fraction Trick

steps.action: Convert percentage increase into fraction (positive sign )
steps.action_hi: Percentage increase ko fraction mein convert karo (positive sign)

steps.action: Flip the sign of numerator, Change denominator to (Y+X) to get decrease fraction
steps.action_hi: Increase fraction ke numerator ko negative kar do, and denominator ko (Y+X) kar do to get decrease fraction

trick.memory_hook: Increase fraction ke numerator ko negative kar do, and denominator ko (Y+X) kar do to get decrease fraction

steps.action: Convert percentage increase to remaining price fraction
steps.action_hi: Percentage increase ko remaining price fraction mein convert karo

steps.action: Take reciprocal for consumption fraction, then find decrease percentage
steps.action_hi: Consumption fraction ke liye reciprocal lo, phir decrease percentage nikalo

common_mistakes.mistake: Reciprocal nahi lete, direct percentage use kar lete hain
common_mistakes.why: Expenditure same rakhne ke liye reciprocal lena padta hai, direct percentage same nahi hota

common_mistakes.mistake: Same percentage assume kar lete hain
common_mistakes.why: Base change hota hai, isliye percentage alag aata hai

deep.explanation:
Concept simple hai: Expenditure = Price × Consumption.

Agar price X% kam hoti hai, to wo (100–X)% reh jaati hai.
Example: 20% decrease → price = 80% = 4/5

Same paisa kharch karna hai, isliye consumption ko price ke reciprocal ke barabar karna padega.
Price = 4/5 → Consumption = 5/4

Increase = 5/4 – 1 = 1/4 = 25%

Rule yaad rakho:
• Price fraction aur consumption fraction reciprocal hote hain
• Base change hota hai, isliye same % apply nahi hota

Direct Formula:
X/(100–X) × 100

shortcut.explanation:
Quick trick:
1. 20% decrease = -1/5(-ve sign to show decrease)
2. Consumption = +1/(5-1) = +1/4(positive sign to show increase)
3. Increase% = 1/4 * 100 = 25%

Yaad rakhna: decrease fraction ke numerator ko negative kar do, and denominator ko (Y-X) kar do to get increase fraction
